tweets.text: Contractors to @Merton_Council admit failures in management of Mitcham Bridge works caused pollution of Wandle - long term harm still being investigated by @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/T14gNcMfeb

Can anyone who reads this sign this petition.If a landfill can be extended by the govt by overriding council decisions then offensive waste snuck on the permit in a town of 139,000 people it can happen to you-WE CANT BREATHE @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland @StinkStopthe https://t.co/hbjrjdje8c

The @EnvAgency letter is embarrassing-should have been sent months ago while they actually stopped what has turned into a humanitarian disaster with people‚Äôs noses bleeding& exacerbation of asthma, children vomiting. At what point are we evacuated @ClareDinnisEA ? @StinkStopthe https://t.co/TglIq0WPK7

Hit the nail on the head - too late for half arsed sanctions & capping. Our health is being harmed @PHE_EoEngland Close it down & clean up your mess @EnvAgency

Thames Water team arrived while I was at Shortlands sewer this afternoon. They'd traced the culprit in the adjacent industrial estate & served a notice. The green dye is their tracer. They began the cleanup (worker photo with permission). https://t.co/mvMsIjnQqF

@SianieRoo @EnvAgency @DrMickSalt @PHE_EoEngland @AaronBell4NUL 100 percent questioning what the hell is in it and how the hell does a landfill become so out of control. Spread so far. What is being hidden from us????

What no-one will be able to compensate for is the loss of life because this will happen. The mental toll that this is taking on some people will undoubtedly end in loss of life unless more is done and a quicker rate.
Health complaints, both mental and physical are rising - respiratory problems, soreness and irritatation of the eyes/nose/throat, depression, insomnia. The list goes on.
